moves.1... d5 2. Nc3 e6 3. e4 Bb4 4. Bd2 Bxc3: Bad move, but the worse is still to come.
moves.13... Nxg3 14. Rxg3 g6 15. Nf4 b5: White begins to struggle for his life.
moves.16. Rh1 Kh8 17. h4 h5 18. Bd2 a5 19. Rhg: Achille's heel in the black defense. White takes the initiative with a beautiful sacrifice.
moves.20... fxg6 21. Bxg6 Qxh4 22. Bg5: An excellent and obvious move for white. Black has a better continuation with ...Qxg3 followed by 23. Rxg3  Rxg6 and black maintains a heavy material advantage.
moves.22... Qxd4: Black falls into the trap and puts his queen on a dead track. She cannot help her king now...
moves.23... Rg7 24. Bxg7+ Kxg7 25. Bd3+: Bxh5 would have been a bad move because after ...Kh6 the white bishop becomes a burden for the white offensive. Furthermore, the black pawn on h5 will be the guillotine for te black king.
moves.25... Kh6: The mate cannot be avoided with ...Kf7 or ...Kf8.
moves.26. Rg3g6+ Kh7 27. Rg6g7+ Kh6 28. Rg1g6#: A brilliant victory. Without the queen and with a strong material deficit, white manages to win.
